*div1 type="summary"* *p*Mrs. J. E. B. Austin to Austin, October 24, 1830. Personal business. */p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*[October 24, 1830.]*/p* *p** * * writing now and I am anxious to know how the business is or will be settled. You told me *date_mentioned n="Spring-1830">last spring*/date_mentioned* you would send me down a pertition to sign—for *location_mentioned*one league of land—on Galviston*/location_mentioned*. I want to know if the pertition was answered—or whether you are autherized to grant it. I also wish to know what right *person_mentioned*John */person_mentioned*had to Lease out my *location_mentioned*hous and 10-acres*/location_mentioned* for five years, that I always considered my property, and it is hard to give it up. I loaned *person_mentioned*John*/person_mentioned* last *date_mentioned n="Spring-1830">spring */date_mentioned*My watch on a business day. he has not returned it. that I wish to reserve myself for *person_mentioned*Stephen */person_mentioned*his *person_mentioned*father */person_mentioned*bought it for him and gave it to me to keep it. the *location_mentioned*house */location_mentioned**person_mentioned*John */person_mentioned*knows the circumstance very well. I do wish you to answer my letter and satisfy me. *person_mentioned*Stephen */person_mentioned*is much better but still has the fever— I think I shall be able to break it on him to day. I must conclude by wishing you good health and a safe journey—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Eliza [Austin] Phillips.*/person_mentioned**/p* *p*[addressed:]*person_mentioned* Col Stephen Austin */person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*St. Felipe De Austin*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
